## App

Represents a single App.

**Parameters**

-   `key` **[string][221]** A universally unique key for this App.
-   `permission` **[string][221]** one of "READ", "WRITE", "ADMIN" (note these are additive)
-   `descriptor` **[AppDescriptor][222]** The AppDescriptor built from the Apps descriptor file.
-   `loader` **[AppLoader][223]** The AppLoader which loaded this App.
-   `moduleLoaders` **[Array][224]** An array of ModuleLoaders to use to load any declared app modules
-   `appStore` **[AppStore][225]** The store to use for persistence.
-   `eventService` **[EventService][226]** The Event service.

## bootstrap

bootstrap the app for example by setting up a 
             seurity context and communicating shared secrets 
             to the App for subsequent communication

## getKey

return the unique key of this App

## getKey

The key of this Module

## getPermission

return the assigned permission of this App ("READ","WRITE","ADMIN")

## getType

return the type of this App (static/dynamic)

## getType

The type of this Module

## getUrl

Helper returns the base URL from this Apps descriptor

## getUrl

The URL of the API relative to the App Url

## getUrl

The URL of the Provider relative to the App Url

## getUrl

The URL of the Provider relative to the App Url

## getUrl

The App URL that we should forward our routes to

## getUrl

The URL of the API relative to the App Url

## getUrl

The URL of the webhook relative to the App Url

## getUrl

The URL of the API relative to the App Url

## getUrl

The URL of the API relative to the App Url

## getUrl

The URL of the API relative to the App Url

## getUUID

return the uniquely generated framework identifier of this App instance

## getLoader

return the loader which loaded this App

## getDescriptor

return the App Descriptor this App was parsed from

## getEventService

return event service

## getModuleLoaders

return Module loaders which are available for parsing Module Descriptors

## getModules

return all the modules that have been loaded

## getHttpClient

return the Http client configured for this App

## enable

Toggle enabled flag and notify event listeners

## enable

default behaviour is to simply send an enabled event to all listeners.
             subclasses can extend this behaviour

## disable

Toggle enabled flag and notify event listeners

## disable

default behaviour is to simply send an disabled event to all listeners.
             subclasses can extend this behaviour

## loadModules

Try to parse the AppDescriptor.modules and load 
all the modules in it using any of the passed in ModuleLoaders
Unloadable modules are loaded anyway but automatically disabled

## AppDescriptor

Loads a descriptor in JSON format into a useable object

**Parameters**

-   `descriptor` **[JSON][227]** Raw JSON descriptor parsed from App service endpoint
-   `url` **[string][221]** Optional URL to overwrite the parsed Descriptor URL (e.g. for Docker private URLs)

## ApiModuleDescriptor

Loads API Module fields from a JSON descriptor

## AuthenticationProviderModuleDescriptor

Loads AuthenticationProvider fields from a JSON descriptor

## AuthorizationProviderModuleDescriptor

Loads AuthorizationProvider fields from a JSON descriptor

## RouteModuleDescriptor

Loads Route Module fields from a JSON descriptor

## WebFragmentModuleDescriptor

Loads WebFragment Module fields from a JSON descriptor

## WebhookModuleDescriptor

Loads Webhook Module fields from a JSON descriptor

## WebItemModuleDescriptor

Loads WebItem Module fields from a JSON descriptor

## WebPageModuleDescriptor

Loads WebPage Module fields from a JSON descriptor

## WebResourceModuleDescriptor

Loads WebResource Module fields from a JSON descriptor

## ModuleDescriptor

Loads a descriptor in JSON format into a Pojo

## builder

Wrapper around App services for easier usage

Type: [DockUIAppsBuilder][228]

-   Throws **any** DockuiFrameworkError

## start

initialize App service

## start

initialize App service

## start

initialize App service

## start

initialize and start web server

## shutdown

shutdown App service

## shutdown

shutdown App service gracefully

## shutdown

shutdown App service gracefully

## shutdown

gracefully shutdown web server

## DockUIAppsBuilder

Builder that generates a DockUIApps instance

Validate options and return a new DockUIApps instance

## validate

## HttpClient

Custom Client to perform communication over HTTP with a specific App

**Parameters**

-   `app` **[App][231]** The Remote App.

## init

Oppertunity for subclasses to configure the client before use

**Parameters**

-   `client` **[object][232]** The Http Client instance

## send

perform a relative request against the Apps base URL

**Parameters**

-   `options` **[object][232]** The request options

## get

perform a relative GET request against the Apps base URL

**Parameters**

-   `url` **[String][221]** the URL to GET relative to the App
-   `options` **[Object][232]** optional request config

## get

Retrieve the value for the provided key

## get

Retrieve the value for the provided key

## post

perform a GET request against the App

**Parameters**

-   `url` **[String][221]** the URL to POST to relative to the App
-   `data` **[Object][232]** the data to Post to the App
-   `options` **[Object][232]** optional request config

## transformRequest

**Parameters**

-   `options` **[Object][232]** The Request options prior to send

## transformResponse

**Parameters**

-   `response` **[Object][232]** The raw response object post receive

## AppLoader

Load Apps from App descriptors detected in some manner
             The detection is left down to subclasses.

**Parameters**

-   `appStore` **[AppStore][225]** The store to use for persistence.
-   `moduleLoaders` **[Array][224]** The loaders to use for loading Modules.
-   `eventService` **[EventService][226]** The Event service.

## scanForNewApps

Starting checking some location for new Apps 
             and attempt to load them when found
             Loading them involves fetching AppDescriptor
             and creating a new App passing it in. The App will
             attempt to Load its own Modules and use Events for lifecycle.

## scanForNewApps

Starting listening to Docker events for containers
             and any we dont yet know about when found attempt to load
             a descriptor. If there is one create App and enable
             all of the apps modules then
             Send App Load started Event

## scanForNewApps

Listen to framework events for APP_LOAD_REQUESTED events.
             when detected:
             \- Send APP_LOAD_STARTED Event
             \- Attempt to load descriptor from the URL
             \- Create an App from the descriptor
                 \- If fail send App load failed event
             \- Add the App to our Cache.
             \- Send APP_LOAD_COMPLETE Event
             Listen to framework events for APP_UNLOAD_REQUESTED events
             when detected:
             \- disable all the Apps modules
             \- Remove associated App from cache

## stopScanningForNewApps

Stop checking for new Apps until scan is called again.

## stopScanningForNewApps

Stop checking for new Apps until scannig is enabled again.

## stopScanningForNewApps

Stop checking for new Apps until scan is called again.

## addApp

Add a single App to the cache

## removeApp

Remove a single App from the cache

## getApps

Return all loaded Apps.

**Parameters**

-   `filter` **[Function][233]** function to filter the list of Apps with

## getApp

Return single App by its Key

## getApp

return the App this security context is for

## canLoadModuleDescriptor

Return true if this descriptor can be parsed and is 
             the required format to produce this type of Module

## canLoadModuleDescriptor

Return true if this descriptor can be parsed by this Loader.
             Implementations should:
              \- Parse descriptor
              \- Check and validate values
              \- Return true if can successfully create a Module
              \- Return false if cannot create Module

## loadModuleFromDescriptor

## loadModuleFromDescriptor

Create and return a new RouteModule from the descriptor
             Implementations should:
              \- Parse descriptor
              \- Check and validate values
              \- Return new subclass Module object

## AuthenticationProviderModuleLoader

Create a AuthenticationProviderModule from a descriptor

## AuthorizationProviderModuleLoader

## CachableModuleLoader

Creates a Module object from a descriptor
             \- looks in cache first

## getCache

get an entry from the Cache or null if not exist

## getCache

Return the roles are required to use this module
             or Null if no Roles required.

## setCache

set an entry to the cache keyed on the hash of the descriptor

## canLoadModuleFromCache

Returns true if entry in cache as being loadable
             Returns False if entry in cache as not being loadable
             Returns null if no entry - means another loader should handle it

## loadModuleFromCache

Return the Module saved in the cache

## DockerEventsDelegatingAppLoader

Detect Docker containers and relevent service URLs
             Then delegate loading to UrlAppLoader via events

**Parameters**

-   `appStore` **[AppStore][225]** The store to use for persistence.
-   `appModuleLoaders` **[Array][224]** The loaders to use for loading Modules.
-   `eventService` **[EventService][226]** The Event service.

## isDockerRunning

returns true if detects Docker via the socket

## handleContainerStart

Handle what happens when a Container is started

**Parameters**

-   `container` **[object][232]** the container that was started

## handleContainerStop

Handle what happens when a Container is stopped

**Parameters**

-   `container` **[object][232]** the container that was stopped

## RouteModuleLoader

Create a RouteModule from a descriptor

## UrlAppLoader

Listen to framework events for APP_LOAD_REQUESTED events.
             \- when detected attempt to load descriptor from the URL
             \- and create an App from the descriptor

**Parameters**

-   `appStore` **[AppStore][225]** The store to use for persistence.
-   `AppModuleLoaders` **[Array][224]** The loaders to use for loading Modules.
-   `eventService` **[EventService][226]** The Event service.

## ApiModule

Represents an API Module.

**Parameters**

-   `app` **[App][231]** The App which loaded this module.
-   `descriptor` **[Object][232]** The descriptor used to load this module

## getVersion

The version of the API

## AuthenticationProviderModule

**Extends Module**

Represents an Authentication Provider Module.

**Parameters**

-   `app` **[App][231]** The App which loaded this module.
-   `descriptor` **[Object][232]** The descriptor used to load this module

## getWeight

The weight determines when this provider will fire.
             lower numbers come first starting at 0.

## getWeight

The weight determines when this provider will fire.
             lower numbers come first starting at 0.

## getWeight

The weight determines the order that the WebFragment
             will be displayed starting at 0.

## getWeight

The weight determines the order that the WebItem
             will be displayed starting at 0.

## getWeight

The order with which to inject these web resources.
             Starts at 0 and goes higher.

             from the HTML retrieved from getURL()

## WebResourceModule

**Extends Module**

Represents an WebResource Module.

**Parameters**

-   `app` **[App][231]** The App which loaded this module.
-   `descriptor` **[Object][232]** The descriptor used to load this module

## getResources

The list of JS/CSS Resource objects where:
             type := JS, CSS
             path := path relative to getUrl()

## getContext

The context to inject the resources into for example
             A particular page or set of pages may choose a context
             and all resources which target that context will be injected

## getContext

Load context from the following in order:
              \- Cache
              \- Apps store if exists 
              \- or generate New One and store it

## Module

Represents a single Module loaded from a Module Descriptor.

**Parameters**

-   `app` **[App][231]** The App which loaded this module.
-   `descriptor` **[App][231]** The module descriptor used to load the module

## getName

The Human readable name of this Module

## getRoles

Return the roles are required to use this module
             or Null if no Roles required.

## isCacheEnabled

If Caching is supported and enabled by this module

## AppPermission

Represents the permitted behaviour of a loaded App.
             \- READ App can be notified about events but cannot contribute any modules which modify the system
             \- WRITE (includes READ) App can also contribute Modules such as WebPage WebResource etc which may modify behaviour
             \- ADMIN (includes READ,WRITE) App can also use the managment API to e.g. load,unload,enable,diable Apps and Modules

## SecurityContext

Represents security info required to communicate
             with an APP. E.g. shared secrets etc

## generateNewContext

Generate a unique context with apps key and fresh secret etc
{
      key: key-from-app-descriptor,
      uuid: framework-unique-identifier-of-App,
      secret: a-secret-used-for-jwt-signing-etc,
      framework.url: [https://base.url.of.the.calling.framework.instance][234]
}

## AppService

Use App loaders to detect and load Apps and
             a LifecycleStrategy to enable and disable Apps based on custom rules

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 

### disableApp

Disable a single App

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 

### getModules

Return a single App(s) module(s)

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 
-   `filter` **[Function][233]** 

### getModules

Return a single App(s) module(s)

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 
-   `filter` **[Function][233]** 

### getModule

Return a single App(s) module(s)

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 
-   `moduleKey` **int** 

### getModule

Return a single App(s) module(s)

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 
-   `moduleKey` **int** 

### enableModule

Enable a single App(s) module

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 
-   `moduleKey` **int** 

### enableModule

Enable a single App(s) module

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 
-   `moduleKey` **int** 

### disableModule

Disable a single App(s) module

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 
-   `moduleKey` **int** 

### disableModule

Disable a single App(s) module

**Parameters**

-   `appKey` **int** 
-   `moduleKey` **int** 

## APPSERVICE_STARTING_EVENT

App service events

Type: [string][221]

## APP_LOAD_REQUESTED_EVENT

App lifecycle events

Type: [string][221]

## MODULE_LOAD_STARTED_EVENT

Module lifecycle events

Type: [string][221]

## WEBSERVICE_STARTING_EVENT

Web service events

Type: [string][221]

## EventService

Simple native events service

## enableAppOnLoad

When Apps are loaded successfully - 
      if were not previously disabled, enable them now

## log

Log Lifecycle transition state

## LifecycleEventsStrategy

Hook to add custom events handler logic into AppService

**Parameters**

-   `eventService` **[EventService][226]** The Event Service to listen to
-   `appStore` **[AppStore][225]** The persistent state storage to use

## setup

Used to add event listeners and other setup tasks

## teardown

Used to remove event listeners and other shutdown tasks

## AppStore

Simple Store for persisting App/AppModule state

## set

Store the value against the given key

## set

Store the value against the given key

## delete

Delete an entry by its key

## delete

Delete an entry by its key

## enableApp

Mark an App as enabled in the store

**Parameters**

-   `app` **[App][231]** the app to mark as enabled

## enableApp

Mark an App as enabled in the store

**Parameters**

-   `app` **[App][231]** the app to mark as enabled

## disableApp

Mark an App as disabled in the store

**Parameters**

-   `app` **[App][231]** the app to mark as disabled

## disableApp

Mark an App as disabled in the store

**Parameters**

-   `app` **[App][231]** the app to mark as disabled

## enableModule

Mark a specific Apps Module as enabled in the store

**Parameters**

-   `module` **[Module][235]** the module to mark as enabled

## enableModule

Mark a specific Apps Module as enabled in the store

**Parameters**

-   `module` **[Module][235]** the module to mark as enabled

## disableModule

Mark a specific Apps Module as disabled in the store

**Parameters**

-   `module` **[Module][235]** the module to mark as disabled

## disableModule

Mark a specific Apps Module as disabled in the store

**Parameters**

-   `module` **[Module][235]** the module to mark as disabled

## InMemoryAppStore

Simple Store for persisting App/AppModule state to memory

## validateShape

Check if the object has desired shape

## validateShapes

Check we are working with the right objects or throw

## WebService

Wraps the intialization, configuration and starting/stopping of a web server
             and associated routes etc.

## isRunning

Is the webserver currently serving requests
